User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Blur Identity application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

followersCount.description: Total number of followers the user has.

followedBy.description: An array of user IDs that are following this user.

followingCount.description: The total number of users this user is following.

following.description: An array of user IDs that this user is following.

status.description: The status of the user's account.

blockedUsers.description: An array of user IDs that this user has blocked.

mutedUsers.description: An array of user IDs that this user has muted.

restrictedUsers.description: An array of user IDs that this user has restricted.

isOnline.description: Indicates if the user is currently online.

lastSeen.description: Timestamp indicating when the user was last online.

voiceStatusUrl.description: The URL to the user's voice status audio file.

voiceStatusTimestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the voice status was created.

fcmTokens.description: An array of Firebase Cloud Messaging tokens for push notifications.

PollOption.title: Poll Option
PollOption.description: Represents a single option in a poll.

option.description: The text of the poll option.

votes.description: The number of votes for this option.

QuotedPost.title: Quoted Post
QuotedPost.description: Represents a denormalized, lightweight snapshot of a post that is being quoted.

LinkMetadata.title: Link Metadata
LinkMetadata.description: Represents the metadata of a URL for a link preview.

EventDetails.title: Event Details
EventDetails.description: Denormalized, lightweight snapshot of an event for embedding in a post.

Post.title: Post
Post.description: Represents a user-generated post, which can be a simple text, a poll, a repost, or a quote post.

id.description: Unique identifier for the post entity.

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the post was created.

authorId.description: Reference to the User who created the post.

content.description: The text content of the post (for text and quote posts).

likes.description: An array of user IDs that have liked the post.

voters.description: A map of user IDs to the index of the option they voted for.

repostOf.description: The ID of the original post, if this is a simple repost.

quotedPost.description: Denormalized data of the quoted post, if this is a quote post.

linkMetadata.description: Metadata for a URL to show a link preview.

expiresAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the post will automatically expire and be deleted.

audioUrl.description: URL to the audio file for an audio post.

audioWaveform.description: An array of numbers representing the audio waveform for visualization.

audioDuration.description: The duration of the audio in seconds.

eventDetails.description: Denormalized data of the event, if this is an event post.

isTapToReveal.description: If true, the post content is hidden until the user taps to reveal it once.

viewedBy.description: An array of user IDs who have viewed a 'tap to reveal' post.

Comment.title: Comment
Comment.description: Represents a comment on a post.

postId.description: The ID of the post this comment belongs to.

authorId.description: The ID of the user who wrote the comment.

content.description: The text content of the comment.

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the comment was created.

status.description: The status of the comment, used for the restrict feature.

lastEdited.description: Timestamp indicating when the comment was last edited.

postAuthorId.description: The ID of the user who authored the post being commented on. Used for querying replies.

Bookmark.title: Bookmark
Bookmark.description: Represents a user's bookmark of a post.

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the bookmark was created.

Notification.title: Notification
Notification.description: Represents a notification for a user about an activity.

postId.description: The ID of the post the activity is related to. Not present for follow or message_request types.

activityContent.description: A snippet of the content of the post or comment.

fromUserId.description: The ID of the user who initiated the activity.

read.description: Whether the user has read the notification.

Conversation.title: Conversation
Conversation.description: Represents a direct message conversation between two or more users.

unreadCounts.description: A map of user IDs to the number of unread messages they have.

lastReadTimestamps.description: A map of user IDs to the timestamp of their last read message.

mutedBy.description: An array of user IDs who have muted this conversation.

voiceCallsDisabledBy.description: An array of user IDs who have disabled voice calls for this conversation.

videoCallsDisabledBy.description: An array of user IDs who have disabled video calls for this conversation.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a single message within a conversation.

RoomMessage.title: Room Message
RoomMessage.description: Represents a single message in a public chat room.

ProblemReport.title: Problem Report
ProblemReport.description: Represents a problem report submitted by a user through the help center.

Report.title: Report
Report.description: Represents a report filed by a user against another user.

Call.title: Call
Call.description: Represents a WebRTC voice call between two users.

IceCandidate.title: ICE Candidate
IceCandidate.description: Represents a WebRTC ICE candidate for establishing a connection.

VideoCall.title: Video Call
VideoCall.description: Represents a WebRTC video call between two users.

VideoIceCandidate.title: Video ICE Candidate
VideoIceCandidate.description: Represents a WebRTC ICE candidate for establishing a video call connection.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed for a public, social-media-style application. User profiles are stored in a `/users` collection, while all posts are stored in a single top-level `/posts` collection. This global `posts` collection allows any user to easily query and view all public posts. Security rules are configured to enforce that while all authenticated user can read posts, only the original author (`authorId` must match `request.auth.uid`) can write, update, or delete their own posts. Comments are stored in a subcollection under each post for clear organization. User-specific data like bookmarks and notifications are stored in subcollections under the respective user's document for security and scalability. Messaging is handled through a top-level `conversations` collection, with messages stored in a subcollection. This allows for efficient querying of conversations a user is part of, while keeping the actual message data separate. A `reports` collection is added for moderation purposes, allowing users to report content or other users. A `calls` collection with `callerCandidates` and `answerCandidates` subcollections is added to facilitate WebRTC voice call signaling. A separate `videoCalls` collection with its own candidate subcollections is added for the new video call functionality to keep it isolated from the existing voice call feature.
